description.narrative: Association for Women and Rural Development (AWARD) will promote environmental education in 30-35 schools in the areas surrounding Deorashtre Village in the state of Maharashtra, as well as in the surrounding areas of Walava and Palus. The village of Deorashtre is viewed as agriculturally prosperous, but there are significant problems due to excessive irrigation, continuous growth of crops, use of monoculture practices, and overuse of fertilizers. Environmental education in these areas is provided in schools with minimal effort and emphasis. Award will work with local NGOs and CBOs in Sangli to implement activity based environmental education projects that will focus on issues of water conservation, safe drinking water, agro biodiversity, kitchen gardens, and sustainable agricultural practices. Inter school exchanges of 15 20 students will be organized to enable students to share and learn from each other. Eco clubs will be established in the schools to foster interest among students for environmental conservation, and will be provided with environmental education publications to improve long term availability of information. Students participating in the program will gain a greater sense of the importance of fresh water and methods to minimize the use and waste of available resources.
